title: Rename `torch.nn.MSELoss` to `torch.nn.SELoss`
body_html:
From the documentation here, it seems that the loss is mainly the element-wise squared differences between two vectors.
The reduction function should be able to handle special cases where mean, sum or no-reduction is required.

Does this argument make sense?

❓ Questions and Help

Please note that this issue tracker is not a help form and this issue will be closed.

We have a set of listed resources available on the website. Our primary means of support is our discussion forum:

  • Discussion Forum

The reduction function should be able to handle special cases where mean, sum or no-reduction is required.
Does this argument make sense?

body:
From the documentation [here](https://pytorch.org/docs/stable/nn.html), it seems that the loss is mainly the element-wise squared differences between two vectors.
The reduction function should be able to handle special cases where `mean`, `sum` or no-reduction is required.

Does this argument make sense?

## ❓ Questions and Help

### Please note that this issue tracker is not a help form and this issue will be closed.

We have a set of [listed resources available on the website](https://pytorch.org/resources). Our primary means of support is our discussion forum:

- [Discussion Forum](https://discuss.pytorch.org/)
